intro: Maytenus meruensis, commonly known as the African mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and has a dense canopy with elliptical, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Its bark and leaves contain bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine and pharmacological research. Maytenus meruensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
